p: Overall, analysis revealed that DENV seroprevalence in the Americas was higher than that in Asia (64.4% vs. 46.2%, p<0.01), which was higher than that in Africa (46.2 vs. 18.1%, p<0.001). Seroprevalence data were not available for one study conducted in Tanzania, where multiple arboviruses co-circulate; in the corresponding analysis, positivity for at least one DENV serotype, or West Nile and/or yellow fever virus antibodies, was categorized as positive for “flavivirus IgG” [ 148].
